preqs: Students must have completed at least 48 Monash credit points (60 ECTS) of study prior to enrolling in this unit.
description: This unit requires students to examine a broad range of social-cultural, political-legal and macro business environmental issues that can impact enterprises operating in a global environment. Through the use of readings, case studies and an analysis of current events, students are confronted with specific challenges of conducting business in a global context. These challenges may include but are not limited to: environmental sustainability; crime and corruption; cross-cultural relationship; technological innovation; political and economic risk. The unit encourages an awareness and appreciation of the complexity surrounding these issues in the development of strategic business responses.
